page.title: 06HEALTH CARE NASH AREA
page.content: When a doctor is needed one must go to Winslow, Stony Stratford, Bletchley or Buckingham for consultation. People without transport do have problems but being a friendly neighbourhood a lift is usually available. One person helps regularly by collecting and delivering prescriptions. Hospitals include Stoke Mandeville, Northampton and the new Milton Keynes. Specialised facilities such as child care, X-Rays, etc. are at Health Centres in nearby towns. Dental care is also available in these towns. A mobile breast screening unit was recently in this area. Other services, particularly for the elderly and infirm include district nurses, meals on wheels, home help and transport to Day Centres. The Willen Hospice at Milton Keynes cared for one of our residents before her death.
